runs.comm: short of a length, angling away, left alone
short of a length, quite rapid, 136ks, defended to mid-off

dropped by Najib Zadran. This is a length ball outside off, Hales goes hard at it, gets a thick edge that goes to the left of point. Najib dives, gets both hands to it, but spills it. Clear show of disappointment from bowler and captain. Najib has gone too hard at it, and has ended up grabbing at it
on a length again, pushed wide of mid-off for one
short of a length, angling away, Bell goes for the cut, is beaten
nicely driven away. Gets a length ball outside off, which he drives over the head of cover. No power, just timing
he starts with a bouncer, Hales hooks from outside off. Not in total control of it, but has got enough bat into the shot to clear the man at deep square leg
another bouncer. This one gets big on Hales who is late into the shot. The mis-hit clears that short mid-on, though
he stays short, and this is wide outside off. It is a good old long hop. Bell totally slams this pull through midwicket for four
short of a length, into the body, tucked away for a single
short of a length, just outside off, 139ks, defended with an open face
this one jumps at him from short of a length. Hales's head goes back as he defends this from the high part of the bat

length ball, outside off, he is early into the drive, fails to control it, but ends up chipping it over extra cover. A bit of a nothing shot. Not trying to keep it down, not going all out trying to hit it over the infield
short of a length, rising into the ribs, defended with his weight on his toes
wide half-volley, Bell goes low and drives it over square cover for four. Almost on a knee as he drives
length ball, outside off, Bell has pushed this to deep cover for one
a length ball outside off that seams away. Left alone
another leave outside off
on target first up, a length ball seaming in, takes the inside edge onto the pad
length ball outside off, played back to him off the inside half of the bat. This is a quick ball. Bell clearly late into the shot
floats this one up outside off. Pitches on a length, just outside off, Bell has to play, but then the ball holds its line against the angle to beat him
short of a length, outside off, looks to run this down to third man, but finds point
fuller, 144ks, this one moves back in, beats the inside edge but is headed down leg
wide full ball, Bell drives, gets a thick outside edge that avoids the fielder at point
low full toss, driven to deep cover for one
short of a length, only slightly wide, Hales gets stuck into this. Punches it really hard. Beats short cover-point and also the man at deep cover

another drop. Action replay of the earlier drop. Once again a wide length ball, once again hard hands from Hales, another thick edge, and another failure on Najib's part to take a simple catch at point. Once again hard hands
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
this one moves away, against the angle, after pitching outside off. Left alone
short of a length, outside off, steered away for a single
short of a length, outside off, left alone
low full toss, pushed between mid-off and extra cover for a couple
full, angling in, pushed wide of mid-on for one
short of a length, just outside off, left alone
short of a length, wide, left alone
stays short of a length, no room, defended back to him
short of a length, just outside off, defended with an open face
Dawlat is short again, and chest high at his pace is not good enough. Pulled away for four to deep square leg
short again. Quicker. Good bouncer. Gets it higher too. Hales can't control the hook, but the top edge clears the wicketkeeper
short of a length, just outside off, defended from the crease
bouncer, this is straight and cramps him up. Hales has to duck it
the first time he has pitched up. The ball swings in, takes the inside edge onto the pad. No drama even though Dawlat has appealed vociferously for the lbw
beautiful bowling. Floats one up outside off, gets it to seam away after pitching. Beats the edge as Bell plays tentatively
yorker on off stump, at 143ks, kept out by Bell
angling in, beats the inside edge, hits him on the pad but is headed down leg. Mid-on dives all over this to allow the second
a half-volley, pushed straight of mid-on for two
short of a length, angling in, blocked back to him
steered away to third man for one
some turn first up, turns a bit too far, goes for two leg-byes
tossed up outside off, opens the face on it, gets a single to short third man
flighted, middle and leg, defended to leg
turn for Nabi from outside off to beat the inside edge. Possibly hitting him outside the line
full, on the pads, worked away for a single
plays with the turn, takes a single to wide of short fine leg
long hop, pulled from outside off, Hamid's misfield at mid-on turns one to two
short, wide, cut away, but straight to backward point
short again, pulled away again, Shafiq at deep midwicket misfields to allow them three extra runs

big appeal for lbw as Bell stays deep in the crease to a length ball. He plays for the turn, but it doesn't turn. Not given. Hawkeye shows it clipping leg. Awfully close. Looks worse than it actually is. And it is close enough anyway
short and wide, and he has picked out cover-point again
no timing on this cut but gets a single
tossed up outside off, defended off the front foot
down the wicket, beaten in flight, defended to midwicket
offbreak, middle and leg, worked to leg for one
shimmies down the wicket, not quite close to the pitch of the ball, pushes this to short midwicket
flat, punched down to long-on. Straight enough of the man to be able to come back for the second
tossed up outside off, defended back to him
nice legbreak, dipping on him, just outside off, defended with an open face
quicker flatter ball, Bell goes back and cuts, but finds backward point
tosses this up but offers a low full toss, which Bell drives wide of mid-on. Hamid Hassan comes around from deep midwicket, but slips during his slide, and lets this through for a four
long hop, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
uses the short boundary for a six. Just goes down on a knee and sweeps this length ball over deep square for a six
short, wide, cut away to deep cover for one
quick arm ball, but too full, and runs off the outside edge for a couple
tossed up, turning into the pads, defended to short midwicket
full, clipped off the toes for one
full, on off, turning in, turned to short midwicket
quicker ball, doesn't turn, Bell has to abort his attempt to play this to leg. Defends this back to him
too straight, helped around the corner for a single

short ball first up, hits the bat hard, but Bell has pulled this wide of mid-on for three. Dawlat and Shafiq, chasing the ball, leave it for each other, and Dawlat belatedly fields to allow them an extra run
slower ball, Hales checks his drive, and it lobs over cover

and Hassan gets a wicket on his final night of the World Cup. Something to cheer about at least. On a length, just outside off, seams away a touch. Hales is looking to defend, playing the angle, and ends up edging this through to the keeper
copybook forward-defensive to begin the innings
length ball, angling in, pushed wide of midwicket for a single
short of a length, swift, Bell makes a belated move to withdraw from the shot, and the ball hits the bat. He is lucky it has gone straight into the ground
offbreak, middle and leg, defended to midwicket
dipping on him, turns into him, beats the inside edge, hits the pad, but turning too far down leg
short of a length, outside off, defended to point
arm ball, a touch too full, driven to long-off
plays the lap shot to short fine leg for a single
another paddle, gets a single to fine leg
short of a length, quick, just outside off, Taylor is off his feet as he defends
length ball, angling in, pushed wide of mid-on for one
angling too far into the pads, concedes a leg-bye
short of a length, outside off, off his feet to punch this to point
slower ball gone wrong, it is a wide down the leg side
plays the pull but Hassan is too quick, and he mis-times it to square leg
full, angling in, pushed straight of mid-on for a single
short of a length, angling in, chest high, Taylor is off his feet as he defends
shorter this time, Taylor goes deep in the crease to try to pull, and is beaten by the lack of bounce this time
short of a length, rising again, hits the shoulder of the bat, but this time they take a single to point
short of a length, wide, Bell looks to cut, top-edges it over slip
short of a length, angling in, Bell dabs this down to third man to get to another fifty. Now time for him to slow down as he usually does in ODI innings
short of a length, angling in, he gets behind it in defence
short of a length, outside off, Bell cuts. Beaten. Not short enough for the cut
on a length, shaping away, Bell plays with cement feet, gets an inside edge to long leg
short of a length, angling in, he has defended off the back foot
moves back and across and defends. A good Ashes audition going on
looks to cut, the ball is not wide enough, gets an edge fine of third man for a couple
looks to pull this from outside off, ends up playing it to mid-off
down the wicket to bunt this to midwicket for a single that ends the match
